abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the West
            Beka'a Emergency Water Supply Project is to improve
            health conditions of the population of the West Bekaa
            through the provision of non-contaminated water in increased
            quantities by completely rehabilitating the area's
            water network. This action plan is likely to have a positive
            impact on the number of subscriptions. The extension to the
            grant closing date by 6 months will thus allow for the works
            contractor to assist the Bekaa Regional Water Authority
            (BRWA) in making the connections to the network, as
            subscriptions increase. The closing date for Lebanon,
            project will be extended from November 20, 2011 until May
            20, 2012. This will be the second extension of the project.
